pr_title: Issue #1446 - enable parsing dateTime fractional seconds up to 9 digits

timeline.message:
Issue #1446 - update copyright

Signed-off-by: Mike Schroeder <mschroed@us.ibm.com>

Issue #1446 - enable parsing Time fractional seconds up to 9 digits

Signed-off-by: Mike Schroeder <mschroed@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText:
pretty minor, but I'd like to see a

tag here. otherwise the javadoc gets consensed into one long paragraph and its not as clear whats from the spec vs from us
timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -29,10 +29,13 @@
  * A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone 
  * SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be 
  * provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.
+ * If seconds are specified, fractions of seconds may be specified up to nanosecond precision (9 digits). However, any

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/fhir-model/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/model/type/DateTime.java b/fhir-model/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/model/type/DateTime.java index 02bd2625a4..f6c36259f1 100644 --- a/fhir-model/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/model/type/DateTime.java +++ b/fhir-model/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/model/type/DateTime.java @@ -29,7 +29,8 @@ import com.ibm.fhir.model.visitor.Visitor; * A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone * SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be * provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates. - * If seconds are specified, fractions of seconds may be specified up to nanosecond precision (9 digits). However, any + * + *

If seconds are specified, fractions of seconds may be specified up to nanosecond precision (9 digits). However, any * fractions of seconds specified to greater than microsecond precision (6 digits) will be truncated to microsecond * precision when stored. */

However, any fractions of seconds + * + *

Fractions of seconds may be specified up to nanosecond precision (9 digits). However, any fractions of seconds * specified to greater than microsecond precision (6 digits) will be truncated to microsecond precision when stored. */ @Generated("com.ibm.fhir.tools.CodeGenerator")

diff --git a/fhir-model/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/model/type/Time.java b/fhir-model/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/model/type/Time.java index 22534af445..18e523c17e 100644 --- a/fhir-model/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/model/type/Time.java +++ b/fhir-model/src/main/java/com/ibm/fhir/model/type/Time.java @@ -22,7 +22,8 @@ import com.ibm.fhir.model.visitor.Visitor; /** * A time during the day, with no date specified - * Fractions of seconds may be specified up to nanosecond precision (9 digits). However, any fractions of seconds + * + *

Fractions of seconds may be specified up to nanosecond precision (9 digits). However, any fractions of seconds * specified to greater than microsecond precision (6 digits) will be truncated to microsecond precision when stored. */ @Generated("com.ibm.fhir.tools.CodeGenerator")

Issue #1446 - separate custom javadoc from spec with paragraph tag
